Header: Successful talks likely to pave way for GSP plus again
Content: Reports state that discussions with the European Union on re-evaluating the GSP plus concession on the apparel industry in Sri Lanka have been successful. Speaking to News1st Secretary to the Ministry of Industry and Commerce, S.S. Miyanwala said that a group of officials representing the EU had arrived in the country for talks. He added that the seven-member team had also held talks with the Prime Minister on two occasions prior to their visit to country. The representatives of the EU had expressed their intention to revive the GSP concession for Sri Lanka as there were positive signs to do so. The Secretary to the Ministry of Industry and Commerce was also noted that a favourable decision in this regard could be expected.
